      • getFilterSuffix

        public String getFilterSuffix(int n)
        Get a fragment of the filter which includes the first 'n' selectors concatenated. Example: if the filter has two selectors (bar and foo). Fragments would be:
        • For n=2: "[bar][foo]"
        • For n=1: "[bar]"
        • For n=0: ""
        • Otherwise: throws IllegalArgumentException
        Parameters:
        n -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if n < 1 or n > size()

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
